selenium_swift.alert_handler module

class selenium_swift.alert_handler.AlertHandler(driver)[source]

Bases: object

accept() → AlertHandler[source]

Accepts the alert and prints its text.

cancel() → AlertHandler[source]

Dismisses the alert.

send_keys(text) → AlertHandler[source]

Sends keys to the prompt alert and accepts it.

text() → str[source]

Returns the text of the alert if it exists.

selenium_swift.BrowserManager module

class selenium_swift.BrowserManager.ChromeBrowserManager(option: ChromeOption, service: ChromeService, keep_alive=False, isUndetectChromedriver=False)[source]

Bases: BrowserManager

A class for managing a Chrome BrowserManager instance.

Inherits from the BrowserManager class and provides initialization for Chrome-specific options and services.

Parameters:

  • option (ChromeOption) – The options to configure the Chrome BrowserManager.

  • service (ChromeService) – The service to manage the Chrome BrowserManager instance.

  • keep_alive (bool, optional) – Whether to keep the BrowserManager session alive (default is False).

  • isUndetectChromedriver (bool, optional) – Whether to use an undetectable ChromeDriver (default is False).

class selenium_swift.BrowserManager.EdgeBrowserManager(option: EdgeOption, service: EdgeService, keep_alive=False)[source]

Bases: BrowserManager

A class for managing an Edge BrowserManager instance.

Inherits from the BrowserManager class and provides initialization for Edge-specific options and services.

Parameters:

  • option (EdgeOption) – The options to configure the Edge BrowserManager.

  • service (EdgeService) – The service to manage the Edge BrowserManager instance.

  • keep_alive (bool, optional) – Whether to keep the BrowserManager session alive (default is False).

class selenium_swift.BrowserManager.FireFoxBrowserManager(option: FirefoxOption, service: FirefoxService, keep_alive=False)[source]

Bases: BrowserManager

A class for managing a Firefox BrowserManager instance.

Inherits from the BrowserManager class and provides initialization for Firefox-specific options and services.

Parameters:

  • option (FirefoxOption) – The options to configure the Firefox BrowserManager.

  • service (FirefoxService) – The service to manage the Firefox BrowserManager instance.

  • keep_alive (bool, optional) – Whether to keep the BrowserManager session alive (default is False).

class selenium_swift.BrowserManager.PageScrape(url)[source]

Bases: PageEvent

A class to handle the scraping of web pages.

Inherits from the PageEvent class to utilize event-driven mechanisms for web scraping.

onResponse(**arg):

Handles the response from web requests.

crawl(**args):

Initiates the crawling process by opening the BrowserManager and handling responses.

open():

Placeholder method for opening the BrowserManager.

async crawl(**args)[source]
async onResponse(**arg)[source]
async open()[source]

Opens the specified URL in a new or existing BrowserManager tab.

Parameters:

in (Literal['new-tab', 'this-tab']) – The tab type to open the URL in.

Returns:

The current PageEvent instance.

Return type:

PageEvent

  • dy – Vertical drag offset (in pixels).

async find_element(by: Literal['css_selector', 'id', 'class', 'name', 'link_text', 'partial_link_text', 'tag_name'], value: str, **args) → Element | Frame | Select2[source]

Asynchronously finds a single element by the given selector.

Parameters:

  • by – The strategy to locate the element (e.g., “id”, “css_selector”).

  • value – The value of the selector to locate the element.

  • args – Additional arguments for element handling .

Returns:

An Element, Frame, or Select2 object.

  • value – The value of the selector to locate the element.

  • args – Additional arguments for element handling.

An Element, Frame, or Select2 object.

property id: str
is_at_bottom()[source]

Checks if the element is scrolled to the bottom.

Returns:

True if the element is at the bottom, False otherwise.

is_at_right()[source]

Checks if the element is scrolled to the right edge.

Returns:

True if the element is at the right edge, False otherwise.

Checks if the element is currently displayed.

Returns:

True if the element is displayed, False otherwise.

Checks if the element is currently enabled.

Returns:

True if the element is enabled, False otherwise.

is_selected() → bool[source]

Checks if the element (checkbox or radio button) is selected.

Returns:

True if the element is selected, False otherwise.

property location: tuple

Retrieves the X and Y coordinates of the element’s position.

Returns:

A tuple containing the X and Y coordinates.

property location_once_scrolled_into_view: tuple

Retrieves the X and Y coordinates of the element once it is scrolled into view.

Returns:

A tuple containing the X and Y coordinates, representing the coordinates of the element.

property parent: Element

Retrieves the parent element of the current element.

Returns:

The parent Element.

The current element.

Takes a screenshot of the element and saves it to the specified file.

Parameters:

filename – The path where the screenshot will be saved.

Returns:

True if the screenshot is saved successfully, False otherwise.

property screenshot_as_base64: str

Takes a screenshot of the element and returns it as a base64-encoded string.

Returns:

A base64-encoded string representing the screenshot of the element.

property screenshot_as_png: bytes

Takes a screenshot of the element and returns it as a PNG image in byte format.

Returns:

A byte object representing the screenshot of the element in PNG format.

The current element.

scroll_xy_by(dx, dy)[source]

Scrolls the element both horizontally and vertically by the given offsets.

Parameters:

  • dx – Horizontal scroll offset (in pixels).

  • dy – Vertical scroll offset (in pixels).

Returns:

The current element.

Scrolls the element vertically by the given offset.

Parameters:

dy – Vertical scroll offset (in pixels).

Returns:

The current element.

file_path – The path of the file to be uploaded.

Returns:

The current element.

The current element.

property shadow_root: ShadowRoot

Retrieves the shadow root of the element if it exists.

Returns:

A ShadowRoot object if the element has a shadow DOM, otherwise None.

Raises:

NoSuchElementException – If the element does not have a shadow root.

property size: tuple

Retrieves the width and height of the element.

Returns:

A dictionary with the keys ‘width’ and ‘height’, representing the size of the element.

submit()[source]

Submits a form element.

Returns:

The current element.

property text: str

Retrieves the visible text content of the element.

Returns:

The text content of the element.

uncheck()[source]

Uncheck a checkbox if it is already checked. Radio buttons are typically not unchecked.

Parameters:

element – The WebElement to uncheck.

Raises:

ValueError – If the element is not a checkbox.

Retrieves the value of a specific CSS property of the element.

Parameters:

property_name – The name of the CSS property.

Returns:

The value of the CSS property.

wait_for(by: Literal['css_selector', 'id', 'class', 'name', 'link_text', 'partial_link_text', 'tag_name'], value: str, timeout=10) → Expect[source]

Waits for a child element of the current element to be present on the page within the specified timeout.

Example usage:

parent_element.wait_for(‘id’, ‘inp1’, 5).has_attribute(‘display’, ‘block’)

Parameters:

  • by (str) – The type of locator to search by (e.g., ‘id’, ‘name’, ‘css_selector’, etc.).

  • value (str) – The value of the locator to identify the target element.

  • timeout (int, optional) – Maximum wait time in seconds. Defaults to 10.

Returns:

An Expect object, which allows chaining additional conditions like has_attribute or to_be_present.

Return type:

Expect

Bases: object

Waits for all elements matching the criteria to be present in the DOM.

Returns:

async attribute_has_value(attr_name, value, on_try=None) → Element[source]

Waits for the element’s specified attribute to have a particular value.

Parameters:

  • attr_name (str) – The name of the attribute to check.

  • value (str) – The expected value of the attribute.

  • on_try (callable, optional) – Optional retry function.

Returns:

The web element if the attribute has the expected value, otherwise raises TimeoutError.

Return type:

Element

async contains_sub_text(text: str, is_case_sensitive=True, on_try=None)[source]

Waits for the element to contain the specified subtext.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The expected subtext within the element’s content.

  • is_case_sensitive (bool, optional) – Whether the text comparison should be case-sensitive, default is True.

  • on_try (callable, optional) – Optional retry function.

Returns:

The web element if the subtext is found, otherwise raises TimeoutError.

Return type:

Element

async has_attribute(attr_name, on_try=None) → Element[source]

Waits for the element to have the specified attribute.

Parameters:

  • attr_name (str) – The name of the attribute to check for.

  • on_try (callable, optional) – Optional retry function.

Returns:

The web element if the attribute is present, otherwise raises TimeoutError.

Return type:

Element

async has_text_exact_match(text: str, is_case_sensitive=True, on_try=None) → Element[source]

Waits for the element to have an exact text match.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The expected text content of the element.

  • is_case_sensitive (bool, optional) – Whether the text comparison should be case-sensitive, default is True.

  • on_try (callable, optional) – Optional retry function.

Returns:

The web element if the text matches, otherwise raises TimeoutError.

Return type:

Element

selenium_swift.extensions module

class selenium_swift.extensions.ChromeExtension(extension_path: str, extension_id)[source]

Bases: PageEvent

A class to manage a Chrome extension.

Inherits from the PageEvent class to utilize event-driven mechanisms for handling Chrome extensions.

Parameters:

  • extension_path (str) – The file system path to the Chrome extension directory. Example for Windows 10: ‘…DefaultExtensionsmajdfhpaihoncoakbjgbdhglocklcgnox.x.x…’ Example for Linux/Mac: ‘…/Default/Extensions/majdfhpaihoncoakbjgbdhglocklcgno/x.x.x…’

  • extension_id (str) – The unique identifier of the Chrome extension. Example: ‘majdfhpaihoncoakbjgbdhglocklcgno’

extension_path

The path to the Chrome extension.

Type:

str

url_extension

The URL to access the popup of the Chrome extension.

Type:

str

__init__(extension_path: str, extension_id: str):

Initializes the ChromeExtension with the provided path and ID, constructing the URL for the extension’s popup page.

selenium_swift.mouse_controller module

class selenium_swift.mouse_controller.MouseController(driver)[source]

Bases: object

A class to control mouse actions using Selenium’s ActionChains.

This class provides methods to perform various mouse operations, such as moving the mouse, clicking, and dragging.

Parameters:

page (web_driver) – driver: The Selenium WebDriver instance.

click(button: Literal['left', 'right'] = 'left')[source]

Perform a mouse click with the specified button.

Parameters:

button – The mouse button to click (‘left’, ‘right’).

double_click()[source]

Perform a double-click action.

mouse_down(button: Literal['left', 'right'] = 'left')[source]

Press the specified mouse button down.

Parameters:

button – The mouse button to press down (‘left’, ‘right’).

mouse_up(button: Literal['left', 'right'] = 'left')[source]

Release the specified mouse button.

Parameters:

button – The mouse button to release (‘left’, ‘right’).

move_by(dx: int, dy: int)[source]

Move the mouse by the relative offset (dx, dy).

Parameters:

  • dx – The x-coordinate offset to move the mouse by.

  • dy – The y-coordinate offset to move the mouse by.

move_to(x: int, y: int)[source]

Move the mouse to the absolute position (x, y).

Parameters:

  • x – The x-coordinate to move the mouse to.

  • y – The y-coordinate to move the mouse to.

move_to_element(element)[source]

Move the mouse to the specified web element, with an optional delay.

Parameters:

element – The WebElement to move the mouse to.

wait_for(by: Literal['css_selector', 'id', 'xpath', 'class', 'name', 'link_text', 'partial_link_text', 'tag_name'], value: str, timeout=10)[source]

Waits for an element of the current page to be present within the specified timeout.

Example usage:

page.wait_for(‘id’, ‘inp1’, 5).has_attribute(‘display’, ‘block’)

Parameters:

  • by (str) – The type of locator to search by (e.g., ‘id’, ‘name’, ‘css_selector’, etc.).

  • value (str) – The value of the locator to identify the target element.

  • timeout (int, optional) – Maximum wait time in seconds. Defaults to 10.

Returns:

An Expect object, which allows chaining additional conditions like has_attribute or to_be_present.

Return type:

Expect

async wait_for_Download(download_path, timeout=60)[source]

Waits for a download to complete in the specified directory.

Parameters:

  • download_path (str) – The path where downloads are saved.

  • timeout (int) – The maximum time to wait in seconds.

Returns:

True if the download completed, False if it timed out.

Return type:

bool
